title: Functionals and kernels of a left vector space (or module)

blocks.name: clfn
blocks.content: Extend class notation with all linear functionals of a left module or left vector space.
blocks.origin: const class clfn { LFnl }

df-lfl
blocks.content: Define the set of all linear functionals (maps from vectors to the ring) of a left module or left vector space. (Contributed by NM, 15-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-lfl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(clfn, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, co(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), co(co(cv(s2), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), co(co(cv(s2), cfv(cmulr, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3))), cfv(cplusg, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s4))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}

axiom df-lfl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ LFnl =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà((Base `(Scalar ` s0))[‚Ü¶](Base ` s0))| ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` s0)), ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0), ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(Base ` s0),(s1 `((s2[(√ó ` s0)]s3)[(+ ` s0)]s4))=((s2[(√ó `(Scalar ` s0))](s1 ` s3))[(+ `(Scalar ` s0))](s1 ` s4)))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)

blocks.name: lflset
blocks.content: The set of linear functionals in a left module or left vector space. (Contributed by NM, 15-Apr-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2014.)

blocks.content: Commutativity of functional addition. (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-2014.)

thm lfladdcom(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), co(c2, cof(c1), c0)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c4))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cplusg, c3))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clfn, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
} = {
  caofcom(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c4), universe, cfv(cbs, c3), w0)
  fvexd(cbs, c4, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wf(c0, cfv(cbs, c4), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(c4, clmod), wcel(c0, c5))
  lflf(c4, clmod, c0, c5, cfv(cbs, c4), cfv(cbs, c3), c3)
  syl2anc(w0, wf(c2, cfv(cbs, c4), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(c4, clmod), wcel(c2, c5))
  lflf(c4, clmod, c2, c5, cfv(cbs, c4), cfv(cbs, c3), c3)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c4))
  syl3anc(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c3)))), wceq(co(cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), c1, cv(hs0))), wcel(c3, cabl), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c3)))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c3))), wcel(c3, cabl))
  3syl(w0, wcel(c3, cabl), wcel(c4, clmod), wcel(c3, crg))
  lmodring(c4, c3)
  ringabl(c3)
  simprl(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c3)))
  simprr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c3)))
  ablcom(c3, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3), cv(hs1), c1)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c3))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cbs, c3))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.w(w0)
}

  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c5)
} = {

  adantr(w0, (hs0 ‚àà(Base ` c3)‚àß hs1 ‚àà(Base ` c3)), c3 ‚àà Abel)
  3syl(w0, c3 ‚àà Abel, c4 ‚àà LMod, c3 ‚àà Ring)

blocks.name: lflnegl
blocks.content: A functional plus its negative is the zero functional. (This is specialized for the purpose of proving ~ ldualgrp , and we do not define a general operation here.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2014.)

blocks.name: lflvscl
blocks.content: Closure of a scalar product with a functional. Note that this is the scalar product for a right vector space with the scalar after the vector; reversing these fails closure. (Contributed by NM, 9-Oct-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Apr-2015.)

thm lkrlss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(c3 ` c1)‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LFnl ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(LKer ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(LSubSp ` c0)
} = {
  syl3anbrc((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), (c3 ` c1)‚àà c4, (c3 ` c1)‚äÜ(Base ` c0), (c3 ` c1)‚â† ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` c0)), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà(c3 ` c1), ‚àÄ(hs2 ‚àà(c3 ` c1),((hs0[(√ó ` c0)]hs1)[(+ ` c0)]hs2)‚àà(c3 ` c1)))))
  syl6eqss((c3 ` c1), (Base ` c0), { hs1 ‚àà(Base ` c0)|(c1 ` hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c0))}, (c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  lkrval2(hs1, c0, clmod, c1, c2, c3, (Base ` c0), (0 `(Scalar ` c0)), (Scalar ` c0))
  ssrab2(hs1, (Base ` c0), (c1 ` hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c0)))
  ne0d((c3 ` c1), (0 ` c0), (c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  mpbir2and((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), (0 ` c0)‚àà(c3 ` c1), (0 ` c0)‚àà(Base ` c0), (c1 `(0 ` c0))=(0 `(Scalar ` c0)))
  adantr(c0 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c2, (0 ` c0)‚àà(Base ` c0))
  lmod0vcl(c0, (0 ` c0), (Base ` c0))
  lfl0(c0, c1, c2, (0 ` c0), (0 `(Scalar ` c0)), (Scalar ` c0))

blocks.name: lkrssv
blocks.content: The kernel of a linear functional is a set of vectors. (Contributed by NM, 1-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lkrssv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clfn, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(clk, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))
} = {
  syl(w0, wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(clss, c3)))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(clss, c3)), wcel(c3, clmod), wcel(c1, c4))
  lkrlss(c3, c1, c4, c0, cfv(clss, c3))
  lssss(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(clss, c3), c2, c3)
  eqid(cfv(clss, c3))
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)‚äÜ c2)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(LFnl ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(LKer ` c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà LMod)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c4)
} = {

  lkrlss(c3, c1, c4, c0, (LSubSp ` c3))
  lssss((c0 ` c1), (LSubSp ` c3), c2, c3)
  eqid((LSubSp ` c3))
}

  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cbs, c0))

} = {
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, clvec), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wceq(cfv(c4, c1), cfv(c4, c3))), wrex(s0, c5, wceq(c3, co(c1, cof(c6), cxp(c7, csn(cv(s0)))))), wrex(s0, c5, wral(hs0, c7, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), c6, cv(s0))))))

  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, clvec)

blocks.name: eqlkr3
blocks.content: Two functionals with the same kernel are equal if they are equal at any nonzero value. (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2015.)

thm eqlkr3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 = c1)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Scalar ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Base ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(0 ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(LFnl ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(LKer ` c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà LVec)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c9 ‚àà c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c8 ` c0)=(c8 ` c1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c9)=(c1 ` c9))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c9)‚â† c6)
} = {
  eqfnfvd(hs0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  ffnd(c0, c2, c5, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, (c0 : c2 ‚Üí c5), c3 ‚àà LVec, c0 ‚àà c7)
  lflf(c3, clvec, c0, c7, c2, c5, c4)
  ffnd(c1, c2, c5, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, (c1 : c2 ‚Üí c5), c3 ‚àà LVec, c1 ‚àà c7)
  lflf(c3, clvec, c1, c7, c2, c5, c4)
  eqtr2d((c0 ` hs0), (c1 ` hs0), ((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)](1r ` c4)), (w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c2))
  r19.21bi(hs0, c2, w0, (c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)](1r ` c4)))
  mpbid(w0, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)](1r ` c4))), ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c5,(hs1 =(1r ` c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)))))
  mpd(w0, ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c5,(hs1 =(1r ` c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)))), ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c5, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))))
  syl121anc(w0, ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c5, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))), c3 ‚àà LVec, c0 ‚àà c7, c1 ‚àà c7, (c8 ` c0)=(c8 ` c1))
  eqlkr(hs1, hs0, c3, c0, c7, c1, c8, c5, c2, (√ó ` c4), c4)
  reximdva(hs1, c5, w0, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)), (hs1 =(1r ` c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))))
  ancrd((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)), hs1 =(1r ` c4))
  syld((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)), hs1 =(1r ` c4), (c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))
  syl((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), (‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2,(c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))‚Üí(c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)), c9 ‚àà c2)
  adantr(w0, hs1 ‚àà c5, c9 ‚àà c2)
  rspcv(hs0, c9, c2, (c1 ` hs0)=((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), (c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))
  eqeq12d((c1 ` hs0), ((c0 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), (c1 ` c9), ((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), hs0 = c9)
  fveq2(hs0, c9, c1)
  oveq1d((c0 ` hs0), (√ó ` c4), hs1, (c0 ` c9), hs0 = c9)
  fveq2(hs0, c9, c0)
  ex((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), (c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), hs1 =(1r ` c4))
  3eqtr3d(hs1, (1r ` c4), (((invr ` c4)`(c0 ` c9))[(√ó ` c4)]((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)), (((invr ` c4)`(c0 ` c9))[(√ó ` c4)](c0 ` c9)), ((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)))
  oveq2d(((invr ` c4)`(c0 ` c9)), (√ó ` c4), ((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), (c0 ` c9), ((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)))
  eqtr2d(((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), (c0 ` c9), (c1 ` c9), ((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1)))
  adantr((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), (c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), (c0 ` c9)=(c1 ` c9))
  adantr(w0, hs1 ‚àà c5, (c0 ` c9)=(c1 ` c9))
  simpr((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), (c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))
  adantr((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c5), (c1 ` c9)=((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1), (((invr ` c4)`(c0 ` c9))[(√ó ` c4)]((c0 ` c9)[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))= hs1)

blocks.name: lkrlsp
blocks.content: The subspace sum of a kernel and the span of a vector not in the kernel (by ~ ellkr ) is the whole vector space. (Contributed by NM, 19-Apr-2014.)

thm lkrshp3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4)))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(csca, c5))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(c0g, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clsh, c5))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(clfn, c5))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(clk, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, clvec))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c7))
} = {
  impbida(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4))))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2)), wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4))), wne(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  lshpne(cfv(c0, c1), c3, c5, c2, wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c5, clmod))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  necon3bid(cfv(c0, c1), c3, c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4)), wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wb(wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3), wceq(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4)))))
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3), wceq(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4)))), wcel(c5, clmod), wcel(c1, c7))
  syl(w0, wcel(c5, clmod), wcel(c5, clvec))
  lveclmod(c5)
  lkr0f(c5, c1, c7, c0, c3, c4, c6)
  syl3anc(wa(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4)))), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c5, clvec), wcel(c1, c7), wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4))))
  adantr(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4))), wcel(c5, clvec))
  adantr(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4))), wcel(c1, c7))
  simpr(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(c4))))
  lkrshp(c5, c1, c7, c3, c4, c0, c2, c6)
}

thm lkrshp3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí((c0 ` c1)‚àà c2 ‚Üî c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 })))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(Scalar ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(0 ` c6)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LSHyp ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(LFnl ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(LKer ` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà LVec)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c7)
} = {
  impbida(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 }))
  mpbid((w0 ‚àß(c0 ` c1)‚àà c2), c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 }), (c0 ` c1)‚â† c3)
  lshpne((c0 ` c1), c3, c5, c2, (w0 ‚àß(c0 ` c1)‚àà c2))
  adantr(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, c5 ‚àà LMod)
  simpr(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2)
  necon3bid((c0 ` c1), c3, c1, (c3 √ó { c4 }), (w0 ‚àß(c0 ` c1)‚àà c2))
  adantr(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, ((c0 ` c1)= c3 ‚Üî c1 =(c3 √ó { c4 })))
  syl2anc(w0, ((c0 ` c1)= c3 ‚Üî c1 =(c3 √ó { c4 })), c5 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c7)
  syl(w0, c5 ‚àà LMod, c5 ‚àà LVec)
  lveclmod(c5)
  lkr0f(c5, c1, c7, c0, c3, c4, c6)
  syl3anc((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 })), (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, c5 ‚àà LVec, c1 ‚àà c7, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 }))
  adantr(w0, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 }), c5 ‚àà LVec)
  adantr(w0, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 }), c1 ‚àà c7)
  simpr(w0, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó { c4 }))
  lkrshp(c5, c1, c7, c3, c4, c0, c2, c6)

blocks.name: lkrshpor
blocks.content: The kernel of a functional is either a hyperplane or the full vector space. (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm lkrshpor(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wo(wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clsh, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clfn, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(clk, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, clvec))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)))), w0, wo(wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3)))
  olcd(wa(w0, wceq(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)))))), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  biimpar(w0, wceq(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4))))), wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3), wceq(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)))))), wcel(c4, clmod), wcel(c1, c5))
  syl(w0, wcel(c4, clmod), wcel(c4, clvec))
  lveclmod(c4)
  lkr0f(c4, c1, c5, c0, c3, cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)), cfv(csca, c4))
  orcd(wa(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)))))), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  syl3anc(wa(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)))))), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c4, clvec), wcel(c1, c5), wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4))))))
  adantr(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4))))), wcel(c4, clvec))
  adantr(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4))))), wcel(c1, c5))
  simpr(w0, wne(c1, cxp(c3, csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4))))))
  lkrshp(c4, c1, c5, c3, cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)), c0, c2, cfv(csca, c4))
  eqid(cfv(csca, c4))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c4)))
}

thm lkrshpor(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí((c0 ` c1)‚àà c2 ‚à®(c0 ` c1)= c3))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c4)

} = {

  olcd((w0 ‚àß c1 =(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))})), (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, (c0 ` c1)= c3)
  biimpar(w0, c1 =(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))}), (c0 ` c1)= c3)
  syl2anc(w0, ((c0 ` c1)= c3 ‚Üî c1 =(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))})), c4 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c5)
  syl(w0, c4 ‚àà LMod, c4 ‚àà LVec)
  lveclmod(c4)
  lkr0f(c4, c1, c5, c0, c3, (0 `(Scalar ` c4)), (Scalar ` c4))
  orcd((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))})), (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, (c0 ` c1)= c3)
  syl3anc((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))})), (c0 ` c1)‚àà c2, c4 ‚àà LVec, c1 ‚àà c5, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))}))
  adantr(w0, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))}), c4 ‚àà LVec)
  adantr(w0, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))}), c1 ‚àà c5)
  simpr(w0, c1 ‚â†(c3 √ó {(0 `(Scalar ` c4))}))
  lkrshp(c4, c1, c5, c3, (0 `(Scalar ` c4)), c0, c2, (Scalar ` c4))
  eqid((Scalar ` c4))
  eqid((0 `(Scalar ` c4)))
}

blocks.name: lkrshp4
blocks.content: A kernel is a hyperplane iff it doesn't contain all vectors. (Contributed by NM, 1-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm lkrshp4(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wne(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(clsh, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clfn, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(clk, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, clvec))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
} = {
  impbid(w0, wne(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  sylib(w0, wi(wne(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3)), wo(wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3)))
  orcomd(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  lkrshpor(c0, c1, c3, c2, c4, c5, w0)
  neor(cfv(c0, c1), c2, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
  ex(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3), wne(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  lshpne(cfv(c0, c1), c2, c4, c3, wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3), wcel(c4, clmod))
  syl(w0, wcel(c4, clmod), wcel(c4, clvec))
  lveclmod(c4)
  simpr(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c3))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lkrshp4(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí((c0 ` c1)‚â† c2 ‚Üî(c0 ` c1)‚àà c3))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(LSHyp ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(LFnl ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(LKer ` c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà LVec)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c5)
} = {
  impbid(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚â† c2, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c3)
  sylib(w0, ((c0 ` c1)‚â† c2 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)‚àà c3), ((c0 ` c1)= c2 ‚à®(c0 ` c1)‚àà c3))
  orcomd(w0, (c0 ` c1)= c2, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c3)
  lkrshpor(c0, c1, c3, c2, c4, c5, w0)
  neor((c0 ` c1), c2, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c3)
  ex(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c3, (c0 ` c1)‚â† c2)
  lshpne((c0 ` c1), c2, c4, c3, (w0 ‚àß(c0 ` c1)‚àà c3))
  adantr(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà LMod)

  lveclmod(c4)
  simpr(w0, (c0 ` c1)‚àà c3)
}

blocks.name: lshpkrlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lshpkrex . The value of tentative functional ` G ` is zero iff its argument belongs to hyperplane ` U ` . (Contributed by NM, 14-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: lshpset2N
blocks.content: The set of all hyperplanes of a left module or left vector space equals the set of all kernels of nonzero functionals. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jul-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: islshpkrN
blocks.content: The predicate "is a hyperplane" (of a left module or left vector space). TODO: should it be ` U = ( K `` g ) ` or ` ( K `` g ) = U ` as in ~ lshpkrex ? Both standards seem to be used randomly throughout set.mm; we should decide on a preferred one. (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
